items.q: Which track and field event involves throwing a heavy metal sphere as far as possible?
items.explanation: Competitors 'put' (push) a heavy metal ball—the shot—for maximum distance.

items.q: In American football, the quarterback is the player who throws the ball the most.
items.explanation: The quarterback leads the offense, calls the plays, and initiates the action on every single offensive down.

items.q: A standard professional basketball hoop is exactly 8 feet off the ground.
items.explanation: The standard height of a regulation basketball hoop is exactly 10 feet (3.05 meters) from the floor.

items.q: In which sport do teams pull forcefully on opposite ends of a long rope?
items.explanation: The objective is to pull the opposing team across a designated center line.

items.q: What is the penalty called in soccer when a player is brought down illegally by an opponent inside the penalty box?
items.a: A penalty kick (or simply, a penalty).
items.explanation: It results in a direct free kick on goal with only the goalkeeper to beat from 12 yards out.

items.q: Which gymnastic apparatus features two horizontal bars positioned at different heights?
items.explanation: This is a strictly female gymnastics event requiring immense upper body strength and agility.

items.q: What do the five interconnected rings on the Olympic flag represent?
items.a: The five major inhabited continents of the world.
items.explanation: They symbolize the unity of athletes from Africa, the Americas, Asia, Europe, and Oceania.

items.q: What is it called in baseball when a batter successfully hits the ball entirely out of the playing field fair territory?
items.explanation: This allows the batter, and any runners currently on base, to safely circle the bases and score.

items.q: In pool (billiards), what distinct color is the 8-ball?
items.explanation: In 8-ball pool, pocketing the 8-ball legally wins the game.

items.q: What protective padding do cricket batsmen wear conspicuously on their lower legs?
items.explanation: They protect the legs from being injured by the incredibly hard, fast-moving cricket ball.
